[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Warehouse Management System (WMS) defines requirements for managing company warehouses, inventory, and supplier interactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: WMS supports inventory tracking, product storage, supplier management, and logistics integration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: WMS integrates with supplier databases, logistics systems, and warehouse tracking software.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: WMS provides dashboards for warehouse managers, logistics teams, and company administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: WMS supports barcode scanners, RFID readers, and automation devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: WMS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage  REST APIs for inventory updates  logistics tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: WMS secures transactions via TLS encryption and authentication protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: WMS is optimized for high-volume product records and real-time updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: WMS handles storage  stock updates  supplier management  warehouse analytics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: WMS is configurable for multiple warehouses with different storage capacities and regulations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: WMS connects with transport  auditing  inventory systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: WMS manages warehouse inventory  product storage  supplier details  logistics tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: WMS is designed for warehouse managers  logistics coordinators  company administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: WMS requires network connectivity for real-time inventory updates and tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: WMS relies on accurate product data  supplier details  warehouse space availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with supplier databases for product sourcing details.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect with logistics for shipment tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage warehouses, storing products with space constraints (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track supplier details, including name and products (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log inventory updates, including stock levels and locations (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a dashboard for warehouse inventory tracking and product management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process inventory updates without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store warehouse details, including location, capacity, and product allocations.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store supplier name, contact, and products.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store product details, including name, category, volume, and location.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce authentication, encryption, and access controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with warehouse safety, inventory management, and logistics regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log stock updates and supplier transactions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests warehouse storage capacity, product tracking, supplier management, and logistics integration.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Warehouse regulations, logistics standards, and inventory management policies.
